title: TV miniatures
credit_line:

Emily Boutard and Megafun
brief_description: These six miniature dioramas reflect how home interiors changed to make way for TV across different decades, representing the common places people watched their favourite stories unfold on-screen.

constellations_primary.name: Nightly news and laughs
constellations_primary.description: Throughout the decades on Australian screens, comedy and news have often gone hand-in-hand.

description: Television didn’t just change the way we see the world; it changed the look and layout of our homes. Since TV arrived in Australia in the 1950s, how and where we watch TV evolved alongside its form and function. These six miniature dioramas, designed by Graham McGuffie and handmade by Emily Boutard, reflect how home interiors changed to make way for TV across different decades, representing the common places people watched their favourite stories unfold on-screen.
